message: I think this Egyptian DNS server is  misconfigured to allow DNS zone AXFR requests , this should belong to the university network , anybody got connections there to alert them ?
story: Ahmad Nazmy shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: raw.githubusercontent.com
caption: raw.githubusercontent.com
description: ; > DiG 9.9.5-3ubuntu0.8-Ubuntu > AXFR eg. @FRCU.EUN.eg. +nocomments +nocmd +noquestion +nostats +time=15 ;; global options: +cmd eg. 604800 IN SOA FRCU.EUN.EG. Postmaster.FRCU.EUN.EG. 2015101406 15000 7200 12096000 86400 eg. 604800 IN NS FRCU.EUN.EG. eg. 604800 IN NS RIP.PSG.COM. eg. 604800 IN NS N...

data.message: The same thing actually happened yesterday or the day before with one of North Korea servers and their whole internet domains were exposed! :D
Actually that's the same project which caught North Korea incident :-)
Dear Dr. Ahmed Hassan: please see if you can help notifying someone there to check this. Many thanks!

I know some of these domains owners !
However all the contact is with tedata not the dns server can it help ?
